algorithm_technique: Iterative division by 5 to count factors of 5
problem_summary_simple: Count trailing zeros in n factorial by finding factors of 5.
problem_summary_technical: Calculates trailing zeros in n! by summing n/5, n/25, etc., leveraging prime factorization.
key_insights: Trailing zeros are determined by the number of factors of 10.
Factors of 10 come from pairs of 2 and 5.
The number of factors of 5 is always less than or equal to the number of factors of 2, so we only need to count factors of 5.
